intro: Silene setacea var. macrotricha, commonly known as the woolly catchfly, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as fields and disturbed areas. Silene setacea var. macrotricha is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, known for its showy flowers and adapted structures for pollination.
